name: transcriber
description: AI-powered transcription for audio & video with Whisper â€” self-hosted, fast, and open-source.
readme_summary: Transcriber is an open-source, self-hosted web application that leverages AI (Whisper) to transcribe audio and video files or YouTube URLs. It prioritizes privacy and speed, offering GPU acceleration and a user-friendly interface with features like transcript history and temporary media cleanup.
key_features: Transcribe from YouTube URLs or local audio/video files
Two Whisper backends (openai-whisper, faster-whisper) with fallback
Clean UI with dark/light mode and progress bar
primary_use_case: To provide a private, fast, and self-hosted solution for transcribing audio and video content from various sources, including YouTube.
cover_image_prompt: A digital librarian meticulously organizing and translating ancient scrolls into modern, readable books. The librarian is shown with a glowing tablet displaying audio waveforms, which are being converted into neatly printed text. Around the librarian, subtle holographic projections show YouTube logos and file icons, representing the input sources. The background is a clean, modern library with soft, ambient lighting, hinting at a private, local environment. Small, glowing data streams connect the tablet to the books. The repository name 'Transcriber' is subtly integrated into a sign on a bookshelf. The overall style is a 3D isometric illustration with a focus on clarity and a calming color palette.

name: ExploitDB-Hunter
description: Lightweight && straight forward command-line tool for searching and downloading exploits from Exploit-DB.
readme_summary: ExploitDB-Hunter is a lightweight Python command-line tool designed to simplify the process of searching and downloading exploits from Exploit-DB. It offers an interactive terminal interface, eliminating the need to manually browse the website and copy exploit code.
key_features: Download exploits directly from the command line
Interactive terminal interface for selecting exploits
Filter exploits by type, platform, port, and tag
Adjust the number of search results
primary_use_case: To efficiently find and download exploit code from Exploit-DB via a command-line interface, streamlining the workflow for information security professionals.
cover_image_prompt: A digital librarian with a magnifying glass, sifting through a vast, organized library of glowing digital scrolls representing exploits. The librarian points to a specific scroll, and a holographic projection of the exploit code appears, ready to be downloaded into a secure digital vault. Subtle UI elements showing search queries and download progress are visible on a nearby console. The scene is set in a futuristic, dimly lit archive with neon accents, emphasizing the ease of finding specific information. The overall style is a 3D isometric illustration with a clean, modern aesthetic and a color palette of deep blues, purples, and glowing oranges.

name: ProximityLockSystem
description: Proximity Lock System is a CLI tool that automatically locks your system when your paired Bluetooth device (like your phone/smartwatch) goes out of range. It continuously monitors nearby devices, ensuring your computer stays secure when you step away.
readme_summary: ProximityLockSystem is a Python-based CLI tool that automatically locks your computer when your paired Bluetooth device moves out of range. It continuously monitors nearby devices, providing a privacy-first security solution for users who frequently step away from their workstations.
key_features: Automatic system locking based on Bluetooth device proximity
Command-line interface for setup and control
primary_use_case: To automatically secure a computer by locking it when the user walks away with their paired Bluetooth device, preventing unauthorized access.
cover_image_prompt: A conceptual illustration of a digital key, tethered by a glowing blue energy cord to a smartphone, floating protectively around a laptop. As the smartphone moves further away, the blue cord stretches and begins to dim, causing the digital key to glow red and hover menacingly over the laptop's keyboard. Subtle digital particles representing Bluetooth signals emanate from the phone towards the laptop. The scene is set against a clean, minimalist background with a soft, ambient glow. The overall style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a focus on clear visual storytelling and a modern, sleek aesthetic, incorporating the repository name 'ProximityLockSystem' subtly on a small digital tag near the laptop.

name: storybook
description: Storybook is the industry standard workshop for building, documenting, and testing UI components in isolation
readme_summary: Storybook is a development environment for building UI components in isolation. It provides a workshop for developers to create, test, and document components independently of the main application, supporting a wide range of frameworks and offering numerous addons for enhanced functionality.
key_features: Support for multiple frameworks (React, Vue, Angular, Svelte, Web Components, etc.)
primary_use_case: Developing, documenting, and testing UI components in isolation.
cover_image_prompt: A whimsical, well-lit workshop filled with miniature, perfectly crafted furniture pieces (representing UI components) on individual pedestals. A friendly artisan, holding a magnifying glass and a small blueprint, is meticulously inspecting and polishing one piece. Around the workshop, shelves are neatly organized with labeled boxes (representing documentation and testing). Subtle digital particles and glowing lines connect the artisan's tools to the components, indicating development. The Storybook logo is subtly visible on a workbench. The overall scene should be a 3D isometric illustration with a clean, bright color palette, emphasizing precision and creativity in component building.

name: tuios
readme_summary: TUIOS is a terminal-based window manager built with Go, offering a modern, efficient interface for managing multiple terminal sessions. It features a vim-like modal interface, comprehensive keyboard shortcuts, workspace support, and mouse interaction, leveraging the Charm stack (Bubble Tea v2 and Lipgloss v2).
key_features: Built with Go and Charm stack (Bubble Tea v2, Lipgloss v2)
primary_use_case: Managing multiple terminal sessions efficiently within a single terminal window, providing a desktop-like experience.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled conductor orchestrating a symphony of multiple, distinct terminal windows within a grand concert hall. Each terminal window is a different instrument playing its part, seamlessly integrated and controlled by the conductor's precise gestures. Subtle glowing lines connect the conductor to each terminal, representing keyboard shortcuts and commands. In the background, a large digital score displays the repository name 'TUIOS' and abstract representations of data flow. The scene is illuminated with a cool, focused spotlight on the conductor and terminals, set against a dark, sophisticated backdrop. The style is a 3D isometric illustration with clean lines and a vibrant, yet controlled, color palette, emphasizing organization and control.
